Sentence.sentence: It is building its second ice-breaking ship and setting up research drilling operations on an ice dome 13,422 feet above sea level that is one of the planet's coldest places.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: For instance, new technologies that are building upon existing technology have not found their footing well  enough to appeal to a mass audience, because, in many cases, they need to work effectively with other devices to realize their full appeal.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: As some countries expand operations in Antarctica, the United States maintains three year-round stations on the continent with more than 1,000 people during the southern hemisphere's summer, including those at the Amundsen-Scott station, built in 1956 at an elevation of 9,301 feet on a plateau at the South Pole.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Rising more than 1,000 feet in the middle of the gently rolling plains of Wyoming, the massive column of rock looks as though it was dropped down into this location from a different time and place.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: I try not to go online till my day's writing is finished, and I moved from Manhattan to rural Japan in part so I could more easily survive for long stretches entirely on foot.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Some schools out for profit cynically increase tuitions and count on student loans and federal aid to foot the bill – knowing full well that the students won't make it.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It is situated at the foot of a beautiful mountain.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Altitude sickness usually begins when a climber goes above 8000 or 9000 feet.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: I had it down by my feet between me and the man in the next seat.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: The West Antarctic ice sheet was about 7,000 feet thick.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Scientists agree that key player in this scenario is the West Antarctic ice sheet, a Brazil-size mass of frozen water that is much as 7000 feet thick
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Access to foot traffic and proximity to transit allow the type of entertainment-oriented businesses such as bars and restaurants to stay open later, which attracts both younger, creative workers and baby boomers nearing retirement alike.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: If we're going to force taxpayers to foot the bill for college degrees, students should only study those subjects they're of greatest benefit to taxpayers.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Last year, MATTEL also gave Barbie a flat foot rather than forcing her to be in heels all the time like the original Barbie is.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section B

Sentence.sentence: The sudden decline in foot traffic in recent years, even though it hasn't been accompanied by a massive decline in physical sales, is a critical warning.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

means: follow on operational test 持续运行试验
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 富特绰号，脚异常者，来源于中世纪英语、古英语，含义是“脚”(foot)

example.en: It is eight months since his wife burned her foot.
example.zh: 他妻子已怀孕八个月了。

example.en: She's going to marry you? My foot!
example.zh: 她准备嫁给你？我不相信!

example.en: A: Yon stay here.B: My foot!
example.zh: 甲:你留在这里。乙:我才不留呐!

word_mean: (［复］feet)足，脚：灵长类下肢的远侧部，个体赖以站立与行走，人类足包括跗、跖和趾及其周围组织。另见pes和talipes
，英尺：长度单位，等于1／3码，或12，相当于30.48厘米

Sentence.sentence: All through the night, Alia, Anis, his brothers and neighbours took the books from the library, passed them over the seven-foot wall and hid them in the restaurant.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语浙江卷（6月） 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: And people have been warned not to go out of their homes — not if you walk on foot, at least — between 11 in the morning and 7 in the evening.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语江苏卷 听力 原文

Sentence.sentence: At last - she never knew how long it had taken her - she felt solid ground under her feet.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语浙江卷（10月） 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: First of all, you must wear shoes that cover your feet in the lab.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语全国卷2 听力 原文

Sentence.sentence: Imagine a child standing on a diving board four feet high and asking himself the question: Should I jump?
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: Imagine my surprise when I stepped foot onto UCR's campus, where over 400 organizations exist, ranging from political organizations to karate club.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语浙江卷（6月） 阅读理解 七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: In no time, she became my feet as I read, and splaying across my stomach as I watched television.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语浙江卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: In one week he was the confused owner of a cone five hundred feet high.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: No one can say which brand will work best for you or feel best on your feet, so you have to rely on your experience and on the feel of each pair as you shop.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: On the other hand, whenever I had plunged into deep water, forced by courage or circumstance, I had always been able to swim until I got my feet on the ground again.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: Recently, we bought a twenty-eight-foot travel trailer complete with a bathroom and a built-in TV set.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语全国卷1 阅读理解 七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: Simon had returned to returned to the camp at the foot of the mountain.
Sentence.come: 2014年高考英语全国卷2 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: The girls on the wesleyan academy softball were waiting for their next turns at bat during practice, stamping their feet to stay warm, eighth-grader Taylor bisbee shivered a little as she watched her teammate Paris white play.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: The number of trees larger than two feet across has declined by 50 percent on more than 46, 000 square miles of California forests, the new study finds.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语浙江卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: The parade ends with the boogg being placed on a 40-foot pile of firewood.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语上海卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: The path to dawson was covered with thirty feet of wet snow that could fall without warming.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷3 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: The transition, which flew at 1, 400 feet for eight minutes last month, can reach around 70 miles per hour on the road and 115 in the air.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: Then she ran along the edge of cliff and fell 100 feet, bouncing off a rock into the sea.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语陕西卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: There was no shade as the trees were no more than 3 feet tall.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语全国卷1 阅读理解 七选五 选项

Sentence.sentence: These animals typically live between the surface of the ocean and a depth of about 3, 300 feet—as far as most light can reach.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: This raised the level of the city's streets by as much as 12 feet.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语湖南卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: To construct a working still, use a sharp stick or rock to dig a hole four feet across and three feet deep.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语全国卷1 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: To warm himself, the sailor sat in front of the fire rubbing one bare foot against the other.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语陕西卷 单项填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: When your cat drops a dead bird at your feet, she isn't bringing you a present.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷2 听力 原文

Sentence.sentence: Within two years it had topped out at almost fourteen hundred feet and was more than half a mile across.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: In one case, many researchers working around the ancient Maya city of Copan, Honduras, have located hundreds of small rural villages and individual dwellings by using aerial photographs and by making surveys on foot.
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In one case, many researchers working around the ancient Maya City of Copan, Honduras, have located hundreds of small rural villages and individual dwellings by using aerial photographs and by making surveys on foot.
Sentence.come: 2014年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

脚步, 步伐

sentences.en: See explanatory notes at the foot of this page.
sentences.cn: 参见本页下端的注解。

lj.lj_ly: you would like to sit at my feet and thus acquire my wisdom.
lj.lj_ls: 你欲拜我为师，从而得我之智。

phrase.cizu_name: get one's feet under the table

jx.jx_en_mean: (chiefly Brit.)establish oneself securely in a new situation
begin to participate in an activity

phrase.cizu_name: get (或 start) off on the right (或 wrong) foot

jx.jx_en_mean: make a good (or bad) start at something, especially a task or relationship
jx.jx_cn_mean: （尤指任务或关系）开局好（或糟）

jx.jx_en_mean: have something in one's power or command

lj.lj_ly: a perfect couple with the world at their feet.

phrase.cizu_name: have (或 keep) one's (或 both) feet on the ground
have a foot in both camps

jx.jx_en_mean: have an interest or stake concurrently in two parties or sides

lj.lj_ly: I can have a foot in both the creative and business camps.
lj.lj_ls: 我可同时涉足艺术与商业。

phrase.cizu_name: have (或 get) a foot in the door

jx.jx_en_mean: gain or have a first introduction to a profession or organization

phrase.cizu_name: have one foot in the grave

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal, often humorous)be near death through old age or illness
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式，常 幽默)一脚已入土，行将就木
(非正式)算了吧，去你的吧（表示强烈反驳）

lj.lj_ly: ‘He's clever at his business,’ Matilda said. ‘Clever my foot!’.
lj.lj_ls: “他做生意很精明，”马蒂尔达说。“精明个屁！”。

jx.jx_en_mean: so as to be no longer standing

lj.lj_ly: she was blown off her feet by the shock wave from the explosion.
lj.lj_ls: 她被爆炸的冲击波击倒。

lj.lj_ly: the decision was taken on foot of advice from the Attorney General.
lj.lj_ls: 这项决定是因为司法部长的建议才得以采纳的。

entry.def: Your feet are the parts of your body that are at the ends of your legs, and that you stand on.

example.ex: She stamped her foot again.
example.tran: 她又跺了跺脚。

example.ex: ...a foot injury.
example.tran: 足伤

entry.def: The foot of something is the part that is farthest from its top.

example.ex: David called to the children from the foot of the stairs...
example.tran: 戴维在楼梯下面喊孩子们。

example.ex: ...the foot of Highgate Hill...
example.tran: 海格特山脚下

entry.def: The foot of a bed is the end nearest to the feet of the person lying in it.

example.ex: Friends stood at the foot of the bed, looking at her with serious faces.
example.tran: 朋友们站在床脚处，神情严肃地看着她。

entry.def: A foot is a unit for measuring length, height, or depth, and is equal to 12 inches or 30.48 centimetres. When you are giving measurements, the form 'foot' is often used as the plural instead of the plural form 'feet'.
entry.tran: 英尺(相当于 12 英寸或 30.48 厘米)

example.ex: This beautiful and curiously shaped lake lies at around fifteen thousand feet...
example.tran: 这个形状奇特的美丽湖泊周长约有15,000英尺。

example.ex: ...a shopping and leisure complex of one million square feet...
example.tran: 占地100万平方英尺的购物休闲中心

entry.def: A foot brake or foot pump is operated by your foot rather than by your hand.
entry.tran: (刹车或泵)用脚操作的，脚踏的

example.ex: I tried to reach the foot brakes but I couldn't.
example.tran: 我试图去够脚刹，但是没能踩到。

entry.def: A foot patrol or foot soldiers walk rather than travelling in vehicles or on horseback.

example.ex: Paratroopers and foot-soldiers entered the building on the government's behalf.
example.tran: 伞兵和步兵代表政府进入大楼。

entry.def: In poetry, a foot is one of the basic units of rhythm into which a line is divided.
If you get cold feet about something, you become nervous or frightened about it because you think it will fail.

example.ex: The Government is getting cold feet about the reforms.
example.tran: 政府对改革缩手缩脚。

entry.def: If you say that someone is finding their feet in a new situation, you mean that they are starting to feel confident and to deal with things successfully.
entry.tran: 站稳脚跟;变得自信;能独立行动

example.ex: I don't know anyone in England but I am sure I will manage when I find my feet...
example.tran: 我在英格兰不认识什么人，但是我相信自己一旦站稳脚跟就可以独当一面。

example.ex: Once he had found his feet he was able to deal with any problem.
example.tran: 他一旦变得自信了就能够处理任何问题。

entry.def: If you say that someone has their feet on the ground, you approve of the fact that they have a sensible and practical attitude towards life, and do not have unrealistic ideas.

example.ex: In that respect he needs to keep his feet on the ground and not get carried away...
example.tran: 在那一方面他需要脚踏实地，不能飘飘然。

example.ex: Kevin was always level-headed with both feet on the ground.
example.tran: 凯文总是头脑冷静，脚踏实地。

entry.def: If you go somewhere on foot, you walk, rather than using any form of transport.

example.ex: We rowed ashore, then explored the island on foot for the rest of the day.
example.tran: 我们划船到了岸边，之后余下的时间步行在岛上探险。

entry.def: If you are on your feet, you are standing up.

example.ex: Everyone was on their feet applauding wildly.
example.tran: 每个人都站起身来热烈鼓掌。

entry.def: If you say that someone or something is on their feet again after an illness or difficult period, you mean that they have recovered and are back to normal.

example.ex: You need someone to take the pressure off and help you get back on your feet...
example.tran: 你需要有人为你分担压力，帮你恢复元气。

example.ex: He said they all needed to work together to put the country on its feet again.
example.tran: 他说他们都需要通力协作以使国家恢复元气。

entry.def: If you say that someone always falls or lands on their feet, you mean that they are always successful or lucky, although they do not seem to achieve this by their own efforts.

example.ex: He has good looks and charm, and always falls on his feet...
example.tran: 他长得很帅，也有魅力，总是走好运。

example.ex: While I struggle through life, she lands on her feet.
example.tran: 在我挣扎过活的时候，她却运气亨通。

entry.def: If you say that someone has one foot in the grave, you mean that they are very old or very ill and will probably die soon.
entry.tran: 一只脚踏进了坟墓;行将就木

entry.def: If you say, in British English, the boot is on the other foot or, mainly in American English, the shoe is on the other foot, you mean that a situation has been reversed completely, so that the person who was in the better position before is now in the worse one.
entry.tran: 情况完全逆转;事实恰恰相反

example.ex: You're not in a position to remove me. The boot is now on the other foot.
example.tran: 你没有权力开除我。相反，我现在可以开除你。

entry.def: If you put your best foot forward, you act in a cheerful, determined way.

example.ex: Put your best foot forward and work on the assumption that there is an acceptable solution to every problem you are likely to face.
example.tran: 要尽力而为，要相信你可能遇到的每一个问题都会有一个适当的解决方案。

entry.def: If someone puts their foot down, they use their authority in order to stop something happening.
entry.tran: 拿定主意阻止;执意反对

example.ex: He had planned to go skiing on his own in March but his wife had decided to put her foot down.
example.tran: 他原本打算在 3 月独自去滑雪，但是他的太太决定让他打消这个念头。

entry.def: If someone puts their foot down when they are driving, they drive as fast as they can.

example.ex: I asked the driver to put his foot down for Nagchukha.
example.tran: 我要求司机加大油门去那曲。

entry.def: If someone puts their foot in it or puts their foot in their mouth, they accidentally do or say something which embarrasses or offends people.
entry.tran: (行为或言语)使人尴尬,冒犯别人

example.ex: Our chairman has really put his foot in it, poor man, though he doesn't know it.
example.tran: 我们的主席真的让人很尴尬，可怜的人，尽管他自己没意识到。

entry.def: If you put your feet up, you relax or have a rest, especially by sitting or lying with your feet supported off the ground.
entry.tran: (尤指架起双脚)坐下(或躺下)休息，放松

example.ex: After supper he'd put his feet up and read. It was a pleasant prospect.
example.tran: 晚饭后他会支起双腿，歇一歇，看看书。那真是件很惬意的事情。

entry.def: If you never put a foot wrong, you never make any mistakes.

example.ex: When he's around, we never put a foot wrong...
example.tran: 他在的时候，我们从来不会出错。

example.ex: He hardly put a foot wrong in defence and was fine in attack.
example.tran: 他防守的时候几乎滴水不漏，进攻也很出色。

entry.def: If you say that someone sets foot in a place, you mean that they enter it or reach it, and you are emphasizing the significance of their action. If you say that someone never sets foot in a place, you are emphasizing that they never go there.

example.ex: ...the day the first man set foot on the moon...
example.tran: 人类首次登上月球的那一天

example.ex: A little later I left that place and never set foot in Texas again.
example.tran: 之后没多久我离开了那个地方，从此再也没有回过得克萨斯。

entry.def: If someone has to stand on their own two feet, they have to be independent and manage their lives without help from other people.

example.ex: My father didn't mind whom I married, so long as I could stand on my own two feet and wasn't dependent on my husband.
example.tran: 只要我能够自食其力，不依附于自己的丈夫，嫁给谁我父亲倒是并不介意。

entry.def: If you get or rise to your feet, you stand up.

example.ex: Malone got to his feet and followed his superior out of the suite...
example.tran: 马隆站起身来，跟在他的上司后面走出了套房。

example.ex: The delegates cheered and rose to their feet...
example.tran: 代表们欢呼着站起身来。

entry.def: If you say that someone is under your feet, you are annoyed because they are with you or near you, and are bothering you.

example.ex: The children were running about under everybody's feet.
example.tran: 孩子们在周围乱跑，让所有人都很烦。

entry.def: If someone gets off on the wrong foot in a new situation, they make a bad start by doing something in completely the wrong way.
entry.tran: 一开始就不对;出师不利

example.ex: Even though they called the election and had been preparing for it for some time, they got off on the wrong foot.
example.tran: 尽管他们召集了选举，也为此做了一段时间的准备，但是一开始就走错了。

means.word_mean: 1. a linear unit of length equal to 12 inches or a third of a yard;
2. the foot of a human being;

sentences.sentence: "his bare feet projected from his trousers"

means.word_mean: 3. the lower part of anything;

sentences.sentence: "curled up on the foot of the bed"

means.word_mean: 4. travel by foot;
5. a foot of a vertebrate other than a human being
6. a support resembling a pedal extremity;

sentences.sentence: "one foot of the chair was on the carpet"

means.word_mean: 7. lowest support of a structure;

sentences.sentence: "it was built on a base of solid rock"
"he stood at the foot of the tower"

means.word_mean: 8. any of various organs of locomotion or attachment in invertebrates
9. an army unit consisting of soldiers who fight on foot;

sentences.sentence: "there came ten thousand horsemen and as many fully-armed foot"

means.word_mean: 10. a member of a surveillance team who works on foot or rides as a passenger
11. a group of 2 or 3 syllables forming the basic unit of poetic rhythm
1. pay for something;

sentences.sentence: "pick up the burden of high-interest mortgages"

means.word_mean: 2. walk;
3. add a column of numbers

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English fōt, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch voet and German Fuss, from an Indo-European root shared by Sanskrit pad, pāda, Greek pous, pod-, and Latin pes, ped- 'foot'

means: 英尺(=12 英寸或 30.48 厘米)

sentences.cn: 每个人都站起身来热烈鼓掌。
sentences.en: Everyone was on their feet applauding wildly.

sentences.cn: 你需要有人为你分担压力，帮你恢复元气。
sentences.en: You need someone to take the pressure off and help you get back on your feet...

sentences.cn: 他说他们都需要通力协作以使国家恢复元气。
sentences.en: He said they all needed to work together to put the country on its feet again.

sentences.cn: 他长得很帅，也有魅力，总是走好运。
sentences.en: He has good looks and charm, and always falls on his feet...

sentences.cn: 在我挣扎过活的时候，她却运气亨通。
sentences.en: While I struggle through life, she lands on her feet.

sentences.cn: 你没有权力开除我。相反，我现在可以开除你。
sentences.en: You're not in a position to remove me. The boot is now on the other foot.

sentences.cn: 要尽力而为，要相信你可能遇到的每一个问题都会有一个适当的解决方案。
sentences.en: Put your best foot forward and work on the assumption that there is an acceptable solution to every problem you are likely to face.

sentences.cn: 我们划船到了岸边，之后余下的时间步行在岛上探险。
sentences.en: We rowed ashore, then explored the island on foot for the rest of the day.

sentences.en: I don't know anyone in England but I am sure I will manage when I find my feet...

sentences.en: Once he had found his feet he was able to deal with any problem.

sentences.cn: 恶魔塔耸立在美国怀俄明州起伏的平原中部，高度超过 1,000 英尺，巨大的石柱看起来好像是从另外一个时空掉落在这里的。
sentences.en: Rising  more  than 1,000  feet  in  the  middle  of  the gently  rolling  plains  of  Wyoming, the  massive  column  of  rock  looks as  though  it  was  dropped  down into  this  location  from  a  different time  and  place.

sentences.cn: 这条公路在铺设之时，终点是一座码头，位于摩里斯湖畔，该湖的海拔高度为大约 66英尺，与码头的海拔高度一致。
sentences.en: When it was built, its terminal was a dock on the shore of Lake Moeris, which had an elevation of about 66 feet above sea level, the same as the dock
sentences.from: 18年6月六级真题(第二套)| 听力

sentences.cn: 据苏格兰《每日记录》报道，周日，城堡的主人，76 岁的John Gordon被迫搬离自己的家， 因为Dee 河冲走了将近60 英尺的土地， 使城堡与河流过于接近， 超过了安全距离。
sentences.en: On Sunday, the castle’s owner John Gordon, 76, was forced to move out his property after the River Dee swept away about 60 feet of land, leaving the castle dangerously close to the river, according to the Scottish Daily Record.
sentences.from: 16年12月四级真题（第一套）| 听力

Sentence.sentence: On Sunday, the castle’s owner John Gordon, 76, was forced to move out his property after the River Dee swept away about 60 feet of land, leaving the castle dangerously close to the river, according to the Scottish Daily Record.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: My mother, who is just shy of five feet tall, is normally incredibly soft-spoken, but on the rare occasion  when she got angry, she was terrifying.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Houses built before 1939 use about 50% more energy per square foot than those built after 2000, mainly due to the tiny cracks and gaps that expand over time and let in more outside air.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Six 4-H girls worked to clean the 72 foot curbside that was covered with weeds, rocks and trash.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Almost every child, on the first day he sets foot in a school building, is smarter, more curious, less afraid of what he doesn't know, better at finding and figuring things out, more confident, resourceful (机敏的), persistent and independent than he will ever be again in his schooling – or, unless he is very unusual and very lucky, for the rest of his life.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年6月听力原文
